intro: Xylothamia triantha, commonly known as the three-lobed woodspurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces distinctive fruits that are three-lobed and contain several seeds. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
